p: Resveratrol (3,5,4â€²-trihydroxystilbene) is a natural component of certain foods, such as grapes, has been shown to have anti-HSV activities in vitro and in vivo (Fig. 3.6; Docherty et al. 2004, 2005). Moreover, resveratrol was found to inhibit varicella-zoster virus (VZV) replication in a dose-dependent and reversible manner (Docherty et al. 2006). Two oligostilbenes dibalanocarpol and balanocarpol isolated from the leaves of Hopea malibato exhibited very modest HIV-inhibitory activity in vitro (Dai et al. 1998).
